attributes.additional_details: The current school routes for many local secondary and primary schools are becoming more than routes,but obstacles to pedestrian paths. For an example, the route of redruth school leads children directly past supermarkets where many children go to buy drinks and snacks straight after school time is over. This is a disturbance that a blind eye has been turned on. It must fixed by a diversion of some sort or creating safer routes for pupils and pedestrians.
